author: T Madhavan
text:
Carrie Trybulec, Director of Gandhi Memorial Centre in Bethesda, U.S., interacts with weavers in Anakaputhur—Photo: G. Krishnaswamy

It is necessary to promote the use of natural dyes and fibres in the weaving of saris and other cloth, said Carrie Trybulec, Director of Gandhi Memorial Centre in Bethesda, U.S., on Tuesday.

She was on a visit to the weavers’ community in Anakaputhur near Tambaram. After depending so much on technology, it is astonishing to know people are relying on natural products to make saris. This knowledge should be definitely shared to promote the importance of natural ingredients,” said Ms. Carrie.

She appreciated the efforts of women weavers who wanted to showcase to the world that using natural fibres was viable, she said.

They had plans to display Anakaputhur weavers’ works in a gallery at their centre, she added.

Anakaputhur Weavers Association president C. Sekar said about 25 natural ingredients were used to weave the saris and other cloth.
title: U.S. team lauds use of natural dyes
